Class Product

java.lang.Object
AbstractItem
Product
All Implemented Interfaces:
StockAdjustable
public class Product extends AbstractItem implements StockAdjustable
Product class that represents an item in the inventory. This class extends AbstractItem and implements StockAdjustable. Main Features: - Can handle both perishable and non-perishable products. - Perishable products can have multiple batches with different expiration dates.

  • Constructor Details

    • Product

      public Product(String name, int quantity, LocalDate expirationDate, String section, boolean perishable)
      Constructor for Product. For perishable products, quantity is managed through batches. For non-perishable products, quantity is stored directly.
      Parameters:
      name - Product name.
      quantity - Initial quantity.
      expirationDate - Expiration date (only if perishable).
      section - Store section.
      perishable - true if the product is perishable.

  • Method Details

    • addOrUpdateBatch

      public void addOrUpdateBatch(int qty, LocalDate expirationDate)
      Adds a new batch OR updates an existing batch (if expiration date matches).
      Parameters:
      qty - Quantity to add.
      expirationDate - Expiration date of the batch.

    • getQuantity

      public int getQuantity()
      Calculates total quantity of product. For perishable: sum of all batches. For non-perishable: stored quantity.
      Overrides:
      getQuantity in class AbstractItem

    • getExpirationDate

      public LocalDate getExpirationDate()
      Returns the earliest expiration date (for perishable products).
      Overrides:
      getExpirationDate in class AbstractItem

      public void addStock(int amount)

    • removeStock

      public void removeStock(int amount) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Removes stock (only for non-perishable). Throws error if trying to remove more than available.
      Specified by:
      removeStock in interface StockAdjustable
      Parameters:

    • isExpired

      public boolean isExpired()
      Checks if all batches are expired (for perishable).
      Overrides:
      isExpired in class AbstractItem
      Returns:

    • toString

      public String toString()
      String version of Product. For perishable: shows all batches. For non-perishable: shows quantity.
      Overrides:
      toString in class AbstractItem
      Returns:
      Product details.

    • toCSV

      public String toCSV()
      Converts product data to CSV format for file saving. For perishable: uses first batch details.
      Overrides:
      toCSV in class AbstractItem
      Returns:
      CSV string of product data.
